ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Question bout tradeskills and such
ygData.msgSnippet:
in answer to your question if you have stats food made by baking in the
first slot of your inventory you get those stats added to what you have now,
for
ygData.messageBody:
in answer to your question if you have stats food made by baking in the first slot of your inventory you get those stats added to what you have now, for example this is copy and paste from one of the sites you can find recipes (link to follow)
 
Beer-battered Crab Pie
This is a Banquet
STR: +4   DEX: +2   HP: +16   MANA: +16   
SV DISEASE: +2   SV POISON: +5   
WT: 4.0   Size: LARGE
Class: ALL
Race: ALL
 
this and other recipes can be found at http://www.eqtraders.com/articles/news_page.php along with their trivial, as a side note if you have LDoN expansion you can go to the boat at Abysmal Sea and do the little quests there to get your baking skills up at no cost. You're not going to become a GM Baker and earn this from it but you will be able to feed yourself.
Grandmaster Baker's Spoon
LORE ITEM NO DROP
Slot: PRIMARY,SECONDARY,RANGE,AMMO
Skill Mod: Baking +5%
Effect: Grandmaster's Satchel (Cast Time 10.0)
STR: +10   CHA: +50   WIS: +10   INT: +10   
WT: 0.1   Size: SMALL
Class: ALL
Race: ALL
 
Flaumigavylke
66 Feralkin Epic'd Beastlord
Silver Tears of Flame
 
"Understand your limits, but never limit your understanding"
-------Original Message-------
 
  Howdy,
    I'm relatively new to EQ, an I'm sill feeling my way around things. I do havfe a question. No th Trade skills, Im understand most of them, they're pretty straitforward...but I do have a question bout the cooking one. Why? I understand smithing...get ore, make bars, make weapons/armour...I know in EQ, every so many time units, you automaticlly eat food. Since rations and milk will fill this funcion,  what is the purpose of cookin and brewing? Do you get more food value out of something you've made, as oppoised to the rations and bisquits? Can you eat the food and get boosts from it? Same thing for the brewing? Or is it just a vanity thing to be walking around with something you cooked as opposed to the iron raions and milk thing...
 
---------------------------------------------------------------------
A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion,
butcher a hog, design a building, con a ship, write a sonnet, balance
accounts, build a wall, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders,
cooperate, act alone, solve an equation, analyze a new problem, pitch
manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die
gallantly.
 
 Specialization is for insects.
 
Robert A. Heinlein
